title: Beveridge on expansion - point of view

content.prompt: Beveridge's ideas in the excerpt best support which of the following positions commonly expressed at the time?

choices.label: Mexico and Canada have no right to question or check United States expansion.
The right of the United States to assert power over foreign lands is God given.
The United States foreign policy has always been isolationist and reluctant to intervene abroad.
A smaller federal government was necessary to face the foreign policy challenges of the twentieth century.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify  a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience.
